definition: thin piece/flake/a slice/film/TV play/to slice/to carve thin/partial/incomplete/one-sided/classifier for slices, tablets, tract of land, area of water/classifier for CDs, movies, DVDs etc/used with numeral 一[yi1]: classifier for scenario, scene, feeling, atmosphere, sound etc/Kangxi radical 91
to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale

sentences.english: As you can tell, she is STILL in heavy demand even after all these years.
sentences.chinese: 即使这么多年后，杨紫琼仍然片约不断。

sentences.english: This film brought good luck for him, and he got more movie appointments, but he all refused.
sentences.chinese: 这部影片给他带来了好运，片约不断，但他都回绝了。

sentences.english: I have a couple of offers from Hollywood.
sentences.chinese: 我已经拿到了好莱坞的几个片约。

sentences.english: After starring in Chinese director Feng Xiaogang's big-budget film "The Banquet," she is looking forward to the next film.
sentences.chinese: 拍摄完冯小刚导演的《夜宴》，章子怡期待新的片约。

definition: to appear (in a show etc)/an appearance (on stage etc)
to win instant success (idiom)/to become an instant hit
to be popular/to be in luck/to have good luck/to develop smoothly
to act the leading role (in a movie or a play)/to star/lead actor
